meanings.definition: A statement or assertion that expresses a judgment or opinion.
meanings.sent1: She made several propositions during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The professor's propositions were well-received by the class.
meanings.sent3: His proposition to have pizza for breakfast was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The proposition that cats have nine lives is just a myth.
meanings.sent5: The bold proposition left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: A plan or scheme proposed for consideration.
meanings.sent1: The company presented a new business proposition.
meanings.sent2: We discussed the various propositions for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: Their proposition to build a treehouse in the office was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The proposition to revolutionize the industry was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The detailed proposition outlined all the key points clearly.

meanings.definition: The act of offering or suggesting something for acceptance.
meanings.sent1: Her proposition to organize a charity event was well-received.
meanings.sent2: The proposition of a new policy sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent3: The proposition to have a team-building retreat on a cruise ship raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The proposition of a partnership between the two companies was a game-changer.
meanings.sent5: The generous proposition was a pleasant surprise for everyone involved.
